channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Immediate Action Required – Asbestos & Waste at Purbrook Estate, 18th October
item.description:
I’m writing to raise a serious concern regarding the area behind Magdalen Hall on the Purbrook Estate, specifically in the car park near the fire exits. There is visibly broken asbestos board, a deceased pigeon, and fly-tipped waste that has remained there for several months. I understand this issue has been reported to the council multiple times. This area is frequented by young children, posing a clear health and safety risk. Additionally, an elderly resident living adjacent to the site has raised complaints about the persistent odour. I kindly request that this matter be addressed as a priority and the area cleared without further delay. I have also contacted Sunil Chopra, Sam Dalton, and Emily Hickson regarding this issue, as it reflects a concerning lapse in duty of care. Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Purbrook Street, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor road surface causing damage to my property, 18th October
item.description:
Reported via mobile in the Damaged road category anonymously at 10:52, Wed 24 August 2022 Sent to London Borough of Bexley less than a minute later. FixMyStreet ref: 3776774. Cracks in the road and pavement vibrate our house every ten minutes. Cracks have appeared inside and outside the property this is due to cracks in the road clearly because when a Hgv (a bus every five-ten minutes ) passes by each way, our property shakes throughout. Made many complaints to the council but fail to hear nothing back, nor see any action, after 3 years of trying.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hook Lane, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Speed bump at crossing, 18th October
item.description:
They dug the road up And filled it in but it has all sunk in the ramp part going west bound of the crossing hump and even going slow it is like a kerb and someone will damage there car or wheel or tyre it’s the equivalent of a small crater. It’s getting worse total bodge job by contractor

item.title: Dumped bed, 18th October
item.description:

item.title: There was a large group of black males and females in the range of about 60 or 70 more people on the streets and on the public grass smoking drugs drinking alcohol cars pulling up causing obstruction barbecues. Residence could not sleep with this antisocial behavior alcohol drug taking and loud music this is a regular occurrence on this stretch of Road at this location. Residence feel unsafe to go out of a night with this large group of black males it's quite intimidating can someone from Hackney Council please address this anti-social behavior criminal activity., 17th October
item.description:
Response police attended location in regards to breach of the peace public orders officer confiscated large Jamaican man's Bluetooth speaker. Antisocial behaviour at this location on a daily basis late at night. Hackney Council doing nothing about it.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bradstock Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Near the back fire exit of no.30 W1T 4JD, 17th October
item.description:
I’d like to report what appears to be an incorrect parking restriction sign recently installed on a single yellow line at [no.30 W1T 4JD near the side fire exit door located on the left side to the main entrance door]. The sign shows restrictions from 08:30am to 08:30pm, which contradicts all other single yellow lines in the area that are restricted only from 08:30am to 06:30pm. This space has been used regularly after 6:30pm without issue, and it does not pose a hazard or cause obstruction. It seems the new sign may have been installed in error and I’d appreciate it being reviewed and corrected to avoid potential parking issues and fines.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Cleveland Street, Fitzrovia, London
Report on FixMyStreet
